title: How long does it take for math teachers to grade papers on average in high school? - Quora

response.answer_text: I worked as an assistant to my teacher in high school during my free period. In a heavily populated school, teachers typically have 25–30 students per class, which they tend to have 2–5 of. In this case, with it being something like Geometry (which requires proof checking, etc.), it could take the teacher anywhere from 5–15 minutes to grade one student’s paper. However, math is easier to grade than a subject like English simply because the answers are more definite. The teacher I worked for designed the questions one at a time, ensuring a detailed answer key for each question. Because of this, we practically flew through grading.

Too long. If you follow the “best practices” you will have a warm up, in class assignment, exit ticket and homework from each student everyday except test days at the least. Far better an idea is to take class time to go over answers for warm ups, assignments and homework, and use an electronic auto grading system for the exit ticket. This way students get feedback quicker, learn from and fix their mistakes, and you spend less time grading.
